body: It's dumb, If I sneak in the wool, I hope to get out quickly without them knowing, its practically impossible :(
body_tagged: It's dumb, If I sneak in the wool, I hope to get out quickly without them knowing, its practically impossible :(
title: Hide  Touches to the opponent.

replies.body: Maybe it's broadcasted after 1 minute to give you time to get out before the other team can focus on you? Hiding it completely seems a bit unfair in the fact you wouldn't know you'd lost both wools until the game ends. See what I mean? c:
replies.body_tagged: Maybe it's broadcasted after 1 minute to give you time to get out before the other team can focus on you? Hiding it completely seems a bit unfair in the fact you wouldn't know you'd lost both wools until the game ends. See what I mean? c:

Yea a slight delay sounds good, but maybe something lower like 30 secs.

replies.body:
Maps need to be better organized and regioned before we do this. Considering our region system, it's not really plausible unless we do 70 regions for each side (and shape) of air and mix it with cylinders and cuboids: having one coordinate wrong would screw us up.

If I can, I'll make a regions folder in the maps repo and have an import (import regions/region1.yml) and it'll hopefully play better instead of wicked skybridges and U bridges.
replies.body_tagged:
Maps need to be better organized and regioned before we do this. Considering our region system, it's not really plausible unless we do 70 regions for each side (and shape) of air and mix it with cylinders and cuboids: having one coordinate wrong would screw us up.

If I can, I'll make a regions folder in the maps repo and have an import (import regions/region1.yml) and it'll hopefully play better instead of wicked skybridges and U bridges.

replies.body: Im talking for the tourney, I dont care about it for the public side, It's so much smarter for tourneys, delays wont matter, as an offender, I dont take 30s to get in and out of a wool unless I see fit.

replies.body:
In a competitive game you can not have a broadcast saying 'X touched Y wool' that's ridiculous, it completely ruins any sneaky wool capping, and just allows the defending team to stack defense on that wool room, allowing for a really stalematey game.

DTM was stale enough, don't turn CTW that way ffs.
replies.body_tagged:
In a competitive game you can not have a broadcast saying 'X touched Y wool' that's ridiculous, it completely ruins any sneaky wool capping, and just allows the defending team to stack defense on that wool room, allowing for a really stalematey game.

DTM was stale enough, don't turn CTW that way ffs.

replies.body: What if I, the offender don't want to instantly leave the wool, and I want to wait till the time is right to leave, there is simply no way that you can give the other team that kind of information if they don't know already, its their fault, and they shouldn't be gifted that kind of information, its their fault for not being aware, dont tell them
replies.body_tagged: What if I, the offender don't want to instantly leave the wool, and I want to wait till the time is right to leave, there is simply no way that you can give the other team that kind of information if they don't know already, its their fault, and they shouldn't be gifted that kind of information, its their fault for not being aware, dont tell them

replies.body:
That's a challenge in itself. It's what changes DTM from CTW. With DTM you basically just need to get there. With CTW you need to get back. It's good that it's a challenge and not broadcasting the message is, in my opinion, a completely ridiculous idea.

Something like a 10-15 second timer on the announcement would be good.


@Notal You have bulding blocks, use them.
